title: Array access
objective:
The way to access elements in an array is to use square brackets. Put the number of the element you want to access inside of the brackets. For example:

z=[1,2,3]
print(z[2])

This code will print the number 3. Remember that arrays are zero-indexed, which means the first element in the array has an index of 0, not 1.

Try it by printing 2.

title: For loop
objective:
A for loop is used to run the same code multiple times. For now, we will iterate through an array. For example:

for i in range(10):
	print(i)

This code will print the integers 0-9.

Note:In python, a tab is used for all lines in a for loop, so indent the second line by 1 block.

Print the numbers 0 through 2

title: Square it
objective:
To use an exponent in python, use two asterisks. For example: 

print 2**2
print 2**3

This code will print 4, 8.

Use ** to print 25
